The measurement covers the pseudorapidity region </subfield><subfield code=" ">< 1.0 and the transverse energy range E{sub T}{sup γ} > 30 GeV and is based on 2.5 fb⁻¹ of integrated luminosity. The sample is almost a factor of seven larger than those used for recent published results and extends the E{sub T}{sup γ} coverage by 100 GeV. The result agrees with next-to-leading order perturbative QCD calculations within uncertainties over the range 50 < E{sub T}{sup γ} < 400 GeV, though the energy spectrum in the data shows a steeper slope at lower E{sub T}{sup γ}.</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="536" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="b">AC02-07CH11359</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="650" ind1=" " ind2="7"><subfield "fermilab-pub-09-507-e" "arXiv eprint number arXiv:0910.3623" Phys.Rev.D80:111106,2009 FT Aaltonen, T.; Adelman, J.; Alvarez Gonzalez, B.; Amerio, S.; Amidei, D.; Anastassov, A.; Annovi, A.; Antos, J.; Apollinari, G.; Apresyan, A.; Arisawa, T. Free-to-read Unrestricted online access star A measurement of the cross section for the inclusive production of isolated photons by the CDF experiment at the Fermilab Tevatron collider is presented. The measurement covers the pseudorapidity region  < 1.0 and the transverse energy range E{sub T}{sup γ} > 30 GeV and is based on 2.5 fb⁻¹ of integrated luminosity. The sample is almost a factor of seven larger than those used for recent published results and extends the E{sub T}{sup γ} coverage by 100 GeV. The result agrees with next-to-leading order perturbative QCD calculations within uncertainties over the range 50 < E{sub T}{sup γ} < 400 GeV, though the energy spectrum in the data shows a steeper slope at lower E{sub T}{sup γ}.
